Amazing. Satiated the chocolate craving at first taste. The brownie is very moist and chewy, but not too chewy. I baked it for 25 min which was too long for my oven: the outer edge of the brownie is a bit hard, but still edible. I'll try 20 min next time (yes, there will be a next time).

What a perfect brownie recipe. I'm always cautious of brownie recipes, as they never seem as good as the store bought kind. These blew commercial brownies out of the water. 
Rich, moist and chewy... they didn't last 2 hours in my house.
This recipe is a keeper! Thanks so much!
It's not the moist dense rich brownie I was looking for. Personal preference is why I rated it lower. I even took care to not mix hardly at all. Sorry.
Just awesome.  Chewy and fresh tasting.  Best frosting ever.
I have a sick wife sitting her who was craving a a hot fudge brownie sundae. Made these brownies and they were the perfect consistency for that!

They aren't much to look at but sure make up on taste and texture.  It's hard to impress me with a brownie but the chocolatey chewiness was delicious!  I did not make the glaze...perhaps that would have made them prettier.  They were good without it.

wow! these are moist and chewy and yummy! i did a little tweak though on the glaze. i only used half of the sugar for a double batch and it was just right, since i don't want it to be so sweet. next time i'm gonna add walnuts and maybe some marshmallows. :)

These brownies were a huge hit at the office.  I have to admit I didn't use the Cocoa glaze.  I used a Chocolate frosting with pecans.  I have no choice but to give 5 stars for this recipe.  Thanks for sharing.
Frankie D

I made these last night.I had baked all week-end and was out of nuts but had 1/2 bag of crushed Heath candy bars for baking.These are really good and so easy to make.My sister had never made brownies from scratch until she made these and loved them.No more out of the box for her.Thank you for the recipe Tweety Grams.

These brownies are delicious, easy, and so simple to make that I've already made them twice already in a week or so.  I didn't even make them with the frosting and haven't even put nuts in them yet.  They are even good that way.  Everyone loved them!  Thanks for sharing.

REALLY GOOD!!! 
I make it without the glaze and I use the doubled recipe to make Death By Chocolate; it always pleases my crowd.
So easy and yummy! Great recipe! Thanks.
Great Brownie Recipe.  Made as stated except I used chopped pecans instead of walnuts.  Also I used the Chocolate Buttercream Frosting Recipe on back of the Hershey's Cocoa box. Yum Yum!!
I have never had a scratch brownie turn out so well. Many thanx!

These are wonderful brownies. I was looking for a good scratch brownie recipe and this fills the bill. We are pulling a joke on some pranksters in our church by lacing the brownies with cayenne pepper. Hope ya don't mind if I mess with your recipe.
Thanks Tweety Grams !
Not really what I was expecting; they had more of a cake-like texture, and while they had a definite chocolate taste, it wasn't that "brownie" taste.
OMG!  These are the most delicious brownies ever!!! I've made this recipe 3 times in 2 weeks!  I substitute chopped pecans instead of th walnuts and my family can't get enough!!!  Chocoholic's dream!

I think this is the best brownie recipe I've ever made. I doubled the recipe and used a 10X10 cake pan. Also I didn't put the glaze on top and didn't fill that it needed it. These are very rich without. This recipe cooked very even through out as most brownie recipes don't. I did cut in to the brownies while still warm and they didn't cut well, was kind of crumbly but after completely cooled they cut perfectly. I can't remember but I think I cooked a bit longer because of doubling the recipe. Don't remember how long though. Used butter instead of margarine

These should be considered illegal because they are SO good!!!!  Really easy and they set up beautifully.  I added a little brandy extract to the glaze instead of the vanilla extract but that is all I changed.  Fabulous!!!!  A must try for any brownie fan!!!!!  Thank you, Tweety Grams!!!!!!
Fantastic, and so easy too!

Delicious! I was worried when they came out because they look a little wet, but they are just gooey and chewy and wonderful! I don't like nuts in my brownies so I left those out. In the glaze I substituted peppermint extract for vanilla which gave it a really fun flavor. Thanks for the recipe!
Heavenly!!!   Followed the recipe exactly, just left out the nuts, and my husband raved about them.  Thanks!

Fabulous! These brownies were very moist and good. I followed the recipe exactly, just without the nuts. Also, while my brownies were in the oven, my glaze hardened up, so I added a little hot water to it. They turned out great!
Perfect...and in one pan...I may never be allowed to use a mix again :)   Kids and DH loved them.   I didn't use nuts or the glaze.  We love our brownies unfrosted.

I'd give more if i could. These brownies were the bomb. My 9 yr old made them today all by himself for his school carnival tomorrow. Its a keeper for certain. Not as sweet as i was expecting but hey there chewy and fudgy like i like them to be!

LaGrande,Oregon
Not a nut fan, so i'll leave the nuts out for the school picnic
Mmmmm!  Mmmmm!!  Mmmmm!!!! (as I float in the air).  5 stars, heqq!  You get all 50 of them.  Thanks, Tweety Grams, for this recipe.

I liked the taste (not too sweet); however, these did not turn out to be chewy like the description said.  They were also a bit on the dry side.  I ended up, essentially, with a very good chocolate cake, but it just wasn't the chewy brownie I was looking for.

This would probably be 3 stars from me, but dh liked it. My all-purpose flour bin was empty, and I didn't want to go to the basement to refill it, and plus I wanted to make these healthier, so I used whole wheat pastry flour for all the flour. I also added chia and flax seeds, and substituted sucanat for half the sugar. I would try this next time with regular flour; this turned out quite crumbly and cake-y, while I was hoping for a chewy brownie. Not overly sweet, which was good.
Very rich fudgey flavor.  Easy to make and I like that I didn't have to drag my mixer out.  I have arthritis in my hands but still could mix by hand.

I wish I had had this recipe when my kids were small, it is simple and would be great for little helpers! But it was an easy dessert to pop in after work, too, with ingredients already in the pantry. They are slightly different from box-mix brownies in that they are more rich and less sweet, but they were very chocolatey and chewy and received raves from the family.

I followed the recipe exactly, without the nuts, because I didn't have any on hand. When it came to the glaze, I used a fork to poke holes all over the top of the brownies when they came out of the oven, then poured the glaze over the hot brownies. The glaze soaked into the holes as well as glazing the top and the results were great. Good thing I made a double batch!
the best brownies I don't put the nuts in them since I have a little one under two and she is allergy prone but other than that they are awesome
Yuuuuuuuuuummmmmmmmy!!!! This is a such a wonderful recipe! I did not add the glaze, the brownies came out chewy, chocolatey, and delicious! Thank you for this recipe!
This is my favorite brownie recipe.  I live in Denver and this recipe works well at high altitude.  Thanks so much for this great recipe!
This was such a great recipe.  All the family said to make them again.  The icing just made them.  Thanks for posting this recipe.
I am licking my fingers as I write this, but wanted to make sure I take the time to say one word: YUM!!!!!

These brownies were a hit!  I normally use a mix, but didn't have one on hand today, so thought I would give this one a try since it has so many good reviews.  My children loved it and so did I!! I think I'll be making these in the future rather than using a mix.

These are so good.  I made this recipe last night and my only complaint was I should have doubled the batch.  They are chocolatey, gooey and sinful.  Thank you for sharing this delicious brownie with us.

Wow - this is an incredible recipe!  So easy and fast, it was hard to imagine they would be great - but they are!  Probably the best homemade brownie I've ever had.  Didn't use the glaze because I had some leftover chocolate espresso icing from a previous attempt.  Yum!!!  Thanks, Tweety Grams!
These brownies are the best I've ever tasted. Wow!
These are soo good! I've made them countless times over the years but I took them took work this week and so now i'm back to print off a stack of recipes. Soo good.

I would give zero stars if I could. I made this exactly to recipe specifications, and it turned out stiff, bitter, and dry. Brownies are supposed to be moist and chewy, but these were about as far from moist or chewy as you can get. Brownies usually have a good deal of bitterness due to the fact that they're so chocolatey, but they usually have just enough sweet to balance it out as well. These, however, had absolutely zero sweetness. I'm shocked they have a whole cup of sugar in them. I'm not sure how these have as many good ratings as they do, but please stay FAR away from these "brownies".

I  agree, these brownies are great.  I usually go to a prepared mix.  I doubled the recipe and added a few chocolate chips.  I baked them a few minutes longer as they were not set in the centre.  Next time I will bake them the suggested 25mins at 350 as they turned out to be a little dry around the edges.  Great recipe!

This is a delicious recipe! It was perfect for making with my 2 year old. The only reason I did not give this 5 stars was because I substituted butter for the margarine and chocolate chips for the nuts. Other than that this is perfection!

Tasty recipe! Very easy to make!

First time ever baking brownies, turned out to be amazing! Got finished up immediately.

Oh my these are the BEST! I made the recipe as listed except no nuts. So ooey gooey chocolatey. And so easy to make- I will never ever use boxed brownie mix again! 
Thank you for posting this simple yet delicious brownie recipe.
These are DELICIOUS!!!  So chocolaty and chewy!  I have never had frosting on a brownie, and loved it.  Made these for Superbowl 2016.  Everyone loved them :)
This recipe is very easy. However, the brownies are pretty dry and the texture is unusual. The one really good thing about it is the glaze. I will use it for other recipes.

These brownies are the literal BEST I've ever made. I omitted the walnuts and threw in some mini semi-sweet chocolate chips and they are divine and SO easy to make! I only had dark chocolate powder on hand, but it worked just fine in place of regular cocoa powder. Brilliant! Thank you so much for sharing this recipe!

These are truly great brownies! The glaze is such perfection on the top. I have one other brownie recipe that uses bakers chocolate, that one is fine. But I like how this one advises to melt the butter, cocoa and sugar together, doing so it looks exactly the same as melting baker's chocolate with the butter. I will say too about this website in general, I so appreciate when the site is willing to post one star to three star reviews and not omitting them the way so many "food bloggers" do, them only letting the five star reviews through, dishonestly. Good brownies! Quick and easy. I made the mistake of only making a single batch. A double batch soon followed. They do rise and have a lighter texture. I may make them in a cookie sheet next time for thinner brownies. Other than that, they were a hit with everyone in the house.

56260.Review: This is a simple, handy recipe. I cut the sugar in half and added fresh garlic and onion, sliced black olives, and a splash of red wine. Nice over some angel hair pasta. Thanks Junebug.

This recipe is especially good because you can keep all the ingredients on hand for weeks.  I've enhanced the flavor slightly by using extra virgin olive oil, and a very thin layer of "original" style grated parmesan cheese, which melts over the top in the microwave (the lower fat versions of grated parmesan cheese don't seem to melt and are hardly lower in fat!)  To make it even easier, I add canned chicken or tuna to the sauce before cooking.  I make 4 servings according to the recipe, or double it and store the leftovers in the refrigerator.  Very convenient, and above average in flavor.
This was a good, quick easy sauce. Next time I will put in less sugar as it was too sweet for me. I live with meat lovers so I added some chopped up beef. Thanks for the recipe. :o)

Outstanding flavor!!!  YUM!  My kids absolutely adored the slightly sweet taste -- hence, no leftovers for me for lunch the next day!!!  I did add a lb. of ground chuck (cooked it first and drained it, so I could add it to the sauce).  Thank you so much, Junebug, for this wonderful, quick meal! We truly loved it, and it's a regular "Keeper" in my family!  YUM!  :)

I follow a similar recipe off the back of the tomato sauce can. I make it often. I love the brown sugar in it!

Roxygirl
Everyone in my family loved this! Especially my kids! Will definately be using this recipe again soon!

Pretty good! I like the sweetness the brown sugar adds, and there aren't too many herbs or anything for a kid's palate. I didn't have a bay leaf, so I left that out, and omitted the onions for personal preference. This was good anyway though, and definitely quick and easy to make!

"Hi.  I'm Jen.  And I only used canned premade spaghetti sauce."  But I found myself without any tonight and I wanted to cook some tortellini for dh and the kids to eat while I was out.  This went together very quickly.  I used only a 1/2 tbsp. oil, and splenda brown sugar.  I used onion powder and an Italian blend seasoning instead of the individual ones.  This was sweet enough for my kids (who love sweet sauce) and had enough taste for dh.  Thanks a ton!
I thought this was ok. My husband liked it a lot, but I just didn't care for it. It seemed like it was missing something. But thanks anyways :)
This sauce is sweet and very nice. I liked. It's different.

I gave this 5 stars. My family loves this recipe. The copy of this I got from Joyce's Place. My copy is slightly different. There is no tomato sauce, paprika, or garlic powder. The oilve oil is 2 Tbl, onion is medium - chopped, garlic is 3 cloves - chopped, 1 pound ground beef, tomato paste 6oz, tomato puree 28oz, brown sugar is 2 Tbl, and basil is 1/4 Tsp dried. The rest is the same. The directions are slighty different saute the onions, garlic and ground beef. Driain off fat and add remaining ingredrients. Simmer uncovered at least 1 hour. Thanks for posting a great recipe! Christine (internetnut)

This is delicious! 
My family loves it.
I had leftover meatloaf,
so I cut it into meatball-sized pieces and added it.
I used 1/2 TBSP sugar.
I didn't have any canned tomato sauce, so as a substitute I took a can of tomato paste and added enough water to equal a cup of sauce and used that.
I also used fresh parsley.
This is a great, tasty, easy spaghetti sauce.  'Nuff said!

i loved this recipe! The brown sugar added a little something to an otherwise dull sauce. I did only add 2 tbsp of brown sugar...because i WAS skeptical...but next time i'll make sure i'll use 3!! I also didn't have onions...it was very delicious! I used it on some ravioli that i made!!! :) Great easy, fast, and yummy!!
This is great.  I HATED spaghetti sauce until I made this recipe.  I make it weekly!

Cut the brown sugar down to 2 tablespoons and hubby doesn't like tomatoey red sauces, I know he's crazy, so I added 1 cup of milk and 1/2 cup of parmesan cheese and he just RAVED about it all night long. It was very very good, thanks so much.

I hope it's okay that I review this even though I changed the recipe a lot. I used crushed tomatoes rather than tomato sauce, only a third of the amount of brown sugar, and doubled the garlic powder. I also added half a teaspoon of red pepper flakes. I simmered for 40 minutes rather than 30. Yummy!

I was looking for a meatless sauce and found yours. It was very good.
made as written. 

Thanks Junebug. 

Bullwinkle.
Excellent and so easy!!

This is an excellent and very versatile sauce.I wanted a quick weeknight sauce toserve with my homemade frozen meatballs and this was wonderful.Thank you for posting this.I did double the sauce for  my family of 6 with no problems!

Love, Love, Love this sauce! I was planning on using another sauce from this site, but realized at the last minute that it needed to simmer for 2 hours. I decided to go with this one and I'm glad I did! I cut the sugar down to 2 tablespoons as I was a little hesitant and it seemed perfect. From now on, this will be my go to sauce!!

This is an awesome recipe: quick, easy, and very yummm! I made the sauce as is, but sauted some carrots, bell papper, onion, and mushroom on the side in olive oil, dashed some basil, garlic powder, and onions onto the crisp-tender veggies and added it to the sauce.  Finally, I added a little cooked chicken, cubed.  This made a wonderful chunky sauce that my husband and I couldn't get enough of!

Okay, so I have to say that I was really skeptical about a "speedy" Spaghetti Sauce recipe but I needed one because my DD and her fiancee were coming for dinner at the last minute and I wanted to make Recipe #73932.  And as far as taste, I will NEVER buy sauce in a jar again, and likely no other sauce recipe!! UPDATE: Since my first review of this in June 2007 I continue to make this really easy and delicious sauce for every dish I make that calls for tomato sauce. Thanks for the great recipe JuneBug!

This was great! I just used it to make Baked Stuffed  Pasta Shells (Recipe #106618) and my kids loved it. I followed the recipe exactly, using all the brown sugar called for and the flavour was wonderful. Thanks so much!
This worked great when, after a long day, we just needed something quick and easy to make.  I think next time I will add a can of tomatoes as we like our sauce a little chunky.  Thanks for posting!

This is my new sauce!  It tasted so good, very close to my Italian grandma's.  I only had one 15 oz can of tomato sauce and one of the smaller ones, so I added a can of diced tomatoes.  I also added 1 lb browned ground beef with diced onion and celery, and two good pinches of italian dressing seasoning mix.

This is great!  Love it Love it Love it!!!  I can rarely eat store bought spaghetti sauces for the heartburn hades they put me through but this seemed to just melt into the noodles and be no problem at all.  This is definitely my new stand by.
My family loved this sauce, could be used in so many ways
WOW I was expecting okay for a speedy sauce and this was great!!! I made exactly as posted and it came out sweet but not to much and served it on Chicken Parmesan Recipe #19135 and it was awesome!!!

This was tasty and very easy to make.  I cut the sugar down to 1 tablespoon, which was enough for us.  I omitted the onions just to save some time. I found the sauce to be a tad salty, only because I eat a low sodium diet.  Next time I will pay closer attention to the sodium in the tomato sauce I purchase, which will eliminate this.  I look forward to making this over and over.  Much less expensive than what I was purchasing in a jar.  Thanks for a great recipe.
Great recipe. I needed to find a sauce recipe that didn't call for tomato paste, because I didn't have any. This was excellent

This should be called "The BEST spaghetti sauce recipe!"  I hate ready-made spaghetti sauce in jars, and since that's all I've ever known, I MISTAKENLY thought I didn't like spaghetti.  But with this sauce, I love spaghetti!!
This is my new favorite sauce. Thank you!
This is the easiest spaghetti sauce recipe I have tried, and very tasty too. Will make again. Thanks!
I never thought excellent spaghetti sauce could be this easy!!  I LOVED it!  And, will continue making on a regular basis.  Thanks so much for the great recipe!

Super easy sauce. I was making Junebug's Ziti recipe and realized that I didn't have any meatless spaghetti sauce, only tomato sauce...I tripled this recipe (using 2-28 oz cans of sauce and 1-28 oz can of diced tomatoes and adding 1 1/2 teaspoons of red pepper flakes) and made a double batch of ziti...that's a lot of dinners ready in the freezer. Thanks Junebug
Thank you for posting this recipe.  It is delicious and oh so fast to make!!

I originally tried this recipe because of all the great reviews.  I was skeptical of the amount of sugar, but because of the high reviews, I thought I would simply go by the recipe and see how it turned out.  My family isn't used to sweet spaghetti sauce, so naturally, after tasting it, nobody wanted to eat it.  It was edible though, it might be okay if it were tweaked, but not as is.

Very good, easy recipe when you don't have much time.  I also cut down the amount of sugar (personal preference) and added a little white wine and a dash of red pepper flakes.  Thanks for a great recipe.

Oct. 1, 2008 This was great! It takes the same time to make as it does to heat the water and boil the noodles. I had a 29 oz. can of tomato sauce so I wasn't sure I wanted to put all of the brown sugar in to start. I used 1 tablespoon and that wasn't enough. After adding a 2nd, that was a tad to sweet. But DD added a sprinkle of salt to hers and said it was better than store bought. I also used half the garlic and basil due to personal taste. DS is super picky and I was a little worried about there being bits of onion in a very smooth sauce but they melted right in after I sauted them first in the olive oil and then added the rest of the ingredients. DH also thought this was better than store bought. This is our new spaghetti sauce. Thanks so much for a easy and great tasting recipe. **I have to add that since I've started making this (almost weekly) I've started to use this as a pizza sauce. I use Recipe #70165. Sometimes if I'm in the mood I'll sprinkle the sauce with a little extra garlic and oregano after I spread it on the dough. I just don't tell the picky people. I'm also making DH learn to cook a few things. This was the first thing. He was truely shocked at how easy it was. He's been known to drive to fast food rather than heat up a plate I've left for him because it was easier so that tells you everything you need to know. Thanks again Junebug!

Amazing easy sauce! I cut the sugar in half, and added a dash or so of red wine, and have been making this sauce weekly by popular demand for months now. Finally got around to reviewing. I have also, in a pinch, used a tablespoon of italian seasoning mix, in place of the mix of spices. I use minced garlic, but the garlic powder works great too! Thanks!
This sauce is so easy and tasty too! I'm glad for this recipe because it let's me control the salt.  I used this to make Classic Baked Spaghetti and it was great. Thank you!

This was SOOOO yummy! I didn't have 2 cans of tomato sauce, so I used one can tomato sauce, I can crushed tomatoes and added some ground beef I browned with the same spices... Oh, yeah, I also used Italian spice mix instead of the basil and oregano, and my family cleaned their plates. Will NEVER buy spaghetti sauce again. Thanks Junebug!

I didn't realize I was out of spaghetti sauce and the meatballs and noodles were cooked. So I had to come up with something fast! I'm glad I found this one because it had everything I had on hand. This came out delicious and it was definitely different too. Not in a bad way. I'll probably be making my own spaghetti sauce from now on. Thanks for sharing this recipe ;-)
I didn't have canned tomatoes so I used fresh... it took a little longer because of that but I LOVED the combination of spices.  THANKS!

Quite honestly, I wasn't impressed with this recipe at all and couldn't decipe between 3 stars or two.  I've actually had inexpensive canned sauce that I thought was better.  Yes, it's quick and easy but I probably won't make it again.  Thanks for posting it, though, and I'm glad to see others have enjoyed it more than I.
I always use this when I discover I am out of spaghetti sauce.  I wouldn't say it is the best ever, but it is really good, fast, and easy.  Thanks!

Great basic recipe that is easily redirected to suit your needs!  I will keep this as a foundation recipe in my kitchen.  Found that I didn't have any oregano in the cupboard, so I substituted 1 tsp of italian seasoning.  I also added just a bit more parsley and basil, because I like my sauces spicy.  I added only a can of tomatoes drained, but I can see that this sauce would be wonderful with olives, mushrooms, and other veggies that folks have on hand!  Thanks for helping me out in a pinch!

Small number of ingredients, big taste...what an amazingly quick and delicious recipe! I didn't have the time or the patience to bother with an other spaghetti sauce recipe with a million ingredients that took over an hour to prep & cook. I read the measurements wrong and added a 1/2 tablespoon of garlic powder, oregano, basil, parsley, paprika, and forgot to add the bay leaf, and it still came out quite good. I just popped all the ingredients in and let it simmer for 15 mins. At first it was a tad sweet because of the brown sugar, but I added half of a freshly squeezed lemon to the sauce, let it simmer for another 10 mins. and it was perfect. I loved the explosion of flavor, so i think i'll stick to the more generous measurements from now on.  This is an AMAZING recipe that tastes better than any bottled spaghetti sauce I've ever had!

This was good, a little sweet.  Next time I will cut the sugar in half.  I didn't have tomato sauce so I used two cans of italian diced tomatoes and half a can of tomato paste and added a small can of sliced black olives.  The flavor and consistency was very good!

I did not care for this recipe, it is very bland and the tomato sauce doesn't work well with it. The sauce is VERY thin, not chunk or thick like we would have wanted. To salvage the sauce I added MANY more spices and fresh garlic and let it simmer longer.

Easy and fast. I used a 28 oz can of crushed tomatoes, but that was the only change. Decent recipe, but way too sweet. I used dark brown sugar, so that may have had something to do with it, but next time I will only use 1 tablespoon of sugar. Thank you for posting.

I love sauce that stews for several hours, but if you don't have the time for that, this is a wonderful alternative. I used 1 chopped onion instead of a few tablespoons, added in a chopped green bell pepper, 1-14.5 oz can of chopped tomatoes, and cut the sugar down to 1 tablespoon.
Very good!  I used less sugar and it was perfect.  Thank you!

Loved how quick and easy this was to make. It was a thin sauce, and a little sweeter than I prefer, but tasty.  Added a dash of red wine which went well with the spices.  Next time I will halve the sugar, but keep everything else the same.

Great recipe when you are in a pinch! Comes together quick and uses ingridents I always have on hand...
Added a whole onion and a can of mushrooms... Good stuff!
Thanks so much!

super easy and tasty!  per other reviews i cut sugar to 1 Tbsp.  spices were pretty much doubled.  teeny amount of snp. coupla shakes crushed red pepper flakes and splash of moscato.  used 28oz can crushed tomatoes cause that's what we had.
Easy, fast and good.

A great, quick, and easy recipe! I did make a few changes/additions:<br/>-I added a bit less brown sugar (2.5tbsps); next time I'd add even less, probably 1/2. <br/>-I added 1/2tsp of red chili peppers<br/>-I added an EXTRA 1/2tsp of garlic powder<br/>-and, I added 1 cup of ground beef.

Delicious! I whipped this together for a quick lunch today and it came out great! I actually left the brown sugar out all together because I felt like the tomatoes already have enough natural sugars. I didn't miss the brown sugar at all. I will definitely make this again!

Truly an easy and delicious spaghetti sauce recipe! I have made this countless times in the past several years, yet have forgotten to write a review for it. I use it with spaghetti, meatball subs (turkey meatball subs!), chicken parmigiana, you name it! I always keep the ingredients on hand, as this recipe is the perfect go-to sauce! I've successfully made it in the crock pot for meatballs and it comes out delicious without trying. I have tried different variations, but I do cut the brown sugar by half---it's just too sweet for our tastes with the recommended sugar in the recipe. I've also used Stevia in place of the brown sugar and it has turned out well. I've also subbed out onion powder for the chopped onions for those days in which I'm just too busy to bother. No matter what, this sauce is always a winner! For subs, I like to add a little grated Parmesan to the sauce and it makes it that much better. Thank you for this keeper of a recipe!
So easy and SO DELICIOUS!
Great flavor I definitely will be making again! Also easy to tweak and add veggies of your choice.

60338.Review: This was good, although after only a few minutes the tomatoes were not as soft as I would like .. so next time I will bake for a while, then add the cheese .. thanks Mirjam ..
This was very good, and extremely easy to make. Even my kids wanted more.
I really enjoyed this.  My favorite part is the crispy cheese topping, yummy!  Thanks for posting.  I will make again!
These made a very good side dish. I prefer a firmer tomato so only putting them under the broiler for a few minutes was perfect.

61790.Review: Yummy yummy yummy.  I substitued turkey sausage and  black beans.  We loved it!!  Perfect for a Mexican food craving!

Wow! This is a bomb! Out of optional ingredients I chose chorizo and this was fantastic. Since I did not have refried beans, I made my own with a can of kidney beans, 1 onion, 1 pckg of taco seasoning and 1 tbs jalapeno juice from jar. I also did not have tomato sauce and used 1 can of tomatoes and 2 tbs tomato paste instead, omitting the taco sauce alltogether. I was trying to get as close as possible to the original recipe with all my substitutions. Apart from all that I followed the recipe closely and we really enjoyed these nachos! The salad on top of everything else was great addition, giving it all fresh crunchynes. Thank you for another treat, Rita L!

I left out the chicken, but made the recipe the same other than that.  We had while watching movies and everyone agrees this is an excellent recipe.  They give it 2 thumbs up and I give it 5 stars.  I did use shredded Mexican blend cheese in place of the Cheddar cheese, as we love it.  This is another keeper Rita!
These are great nachos.  I followed ingredients per recipe except  didn't  add chicken or lettuce, or jalapeno.  This made a great lunch for us.  Made for Photo Tag.

I am on the second batch for the Super Bowl party right now.  This is enough nacho party food to feed half the county.  But everyone is raving about it.  I particularly like the lettuce, olives and chorizo additions, which were different than the normal versions one finds everywhere.  Nice job!
I love this it is so good, like everyone else

61940.Review: I was leary about this recipe but LOVE to try new sauces for salmon. I thought it would be too zesty/sour. It was absolutely incredible and surprisingly simple to prepare. I would think you could also use this with a tuna or shark steak too. I think I'll be making this for my Father's Day dinner party this year. Regarding STEP 10...I left the zest in. Thank you for a great recipe. I'm so glad I made it!

Excellent ponzu sauce.  When I juiced all the fruit up I had over 1 1/2 cups and thought it would be too much for the proportion of sugar.  I used 1 cup.  That was about right, but it could have gone to 1 1/4 just fine.    It didn't taste as much of grapefruit as one would expect.   It just tasted citrusy and had a perfect balance.  For cooks new to caramelizing sugar: do stand back when you put the juice in the saucepan - that pan is mighty hot.   I used flathead fillets for the fish.  Nice combination.

I am always looking for new sauce for our salmon.  It was very good.  I had the worst day in the kitchen with everything turning out wrong but this sauce was already done and waiting.  I did it in a non stick pan so clean up was easy.
Excellent dish, the sauce has a great "sweet and sour" touch to it which works really well with the salmon. I tend to cook the salmon hotter for a shorter time but it works any way you want.

Very tasty, especially if you like Asian flavorings.  I got a little ahead of myself and started the salmon too early.  When it was finished, I put it in a 200 degree oven until the sauce was ready with no ill effects.  I wouldn't do this for too long though.  I served this with rice to sop up some of the extra sauce.  I think that a cilantro garnish might add a nice touch, too.

Beautiful ponzu sauce. The method is not too difficult.A lovely light touch for salmon. I decided to sear the salmon under the broiler after very lightly misting the first side with a mixture of sesame and sunflower oil. Garnishes of shiso leaf, shredded rated carrot, and julienned pickled kelp.  Love citrus fruit and mandarins are already on the market. They are little jewels when used as supremes. Some steamed 'Rose' rice on the side. DEElish. Thanks, Meanie...

My husband and I both thought this sauce was superb! And your cooking instructions for the salmon were perfect. I got a beautiful golden crust, although I did shave off about a minute from the cooking time on each side, just for our taste. I cut the recipe in half - 2 fillets and half of the sauce which amounted to about 1/2 cup! Do be careful when you add the fruit juices to the browning sugar. It bubbles furiously, and part of my sugar actually turned solid when the juice hit it. But I worked it through with a wooden spoon, and it eventually blended back in. Whew! I also left the zest in the ponzu.

Beautiful and really good. And not that difficult, either! We loved the sweet/sour sauce with both salmon and tuna steaks. Also loved the method of cooking the fish--perfect description of cooking time for a result with a nice crust that's not overdone, either. The sauce looked gorgeous and white plates with a small bit of fish on it...

Good stuff!  I added some cilantro to the sauce, and served the whole deal over Asian noodles and asparagus spears.  Great combination of flavors.  I think a little garlic added in would also be nice.

Fresh, citrusy, and with a delightful Asian flair.  I prepared the sauce precisely as described and got rave reviews.  I used salmon filets, baked in aluminum foil packets with a dribble of olive oil and salt, and then plated it over the sauce, dribbled some sauce on top and garnished with additional zest.  Beautiful presentation and brilliant flavor.  Thanks!
This was very good to eat and easy to make on a night when I didn't want to miss a thing during my favorite TV Show!
Fabulous, especially the sauce.  I plan to use it on ahi tuna next.  Sure miss Meanie!

I loved this. The sauce is so light, but packed with flavor.  I cooked the fish in foil packets with a little chopped garlic, salt pepper, and some of the fruit juice, and it added a real depth of flavor to the dish when paired with the sauce.  Definately a recipe I will be using again and again.

Excellent flavourful sauce!  It's so quick and easy to throw together.  I've only ever made ponzu as a jelly, so this was a nice change.  Excellent method for preparing the salmon as well.  We really enjoyed the crust.  Yum!  Thanks Mooseybear!
Terrific!

Easy to make and very tasty.  I followed the recipe closely, but I thought there was too much soy sauce and it probably needed MORE sugar.  It was a tiny bit bitter. Yikes!  There is already plenty of sugar in the recipe, but my fruit probably could have been riper.  So I suggest you adjust the sugar depending upon the ripeness of the fruit.  I'll definitely make again and tweak to my liking.  Served with steamed rice and braised baby bok choy.

First off, I have to say that I don't like fish. I bought some salmon because I know it's good for me, but I didn't really like it the first time I prepared it. I decided it needed some strong flavors to accompany it and so I found this recipe. It is easy, quick, and I really enjoyed it!! I didn't think I would be buying salmon again, but we discussed having this meal again while we were eating last night. I was afraid there would be too much soy sauce, but I made the recipe exactly how it's written, and it turned out beautifully. I loved the "crust" on the salmon, it created a great mouthfeel (which is a reason I think I don't like fish--it's too soft feeling). I was afraid that just salting would make it bland, but with the sauce, it was perfect. I didn't "puddle" the sauce on the plate, but served it in tiny bowls on the side so we could dip as much or as little as we wanted. Thanks Mooseybear!!
Mooseybear, I have to say, "This is one heck of a delicious dish"!  We loved the sauce and it made the salmon taste spectacular!  Definatly 5 stars on this one just the way it is!

Very delicious! I meant to take a picture of the finished product, but we ate it up before I remembered!!! I didn't have any grapefruits or limes on hand, so I just used 3 oranges and a few teaspoons of lemon juice. It still turned out great! I would probably add a bit of cornstarch to thicken the sauce up just a bit, but other than that I wouldn't change a thing! Thank you!

Thank you for this recipe! I was initially looking for just a ponzu sauce as my husband is obsessed with the stuff and it's ridiculously expensive to buy (only available at one specialty store). Then I saw the recipe for salmon and was ery excited as my husband also loves salmon and we live on the coast and have it fresh often. The recipe lived up to my hope and more!!!
I added some red hot peppers in the sauce, and it was delicious to dip our sushi in.  We loved it!  I will try it with the salmon sometime, but for now wanted to review the sauce!

Very easy to put together.

BF and I both loved it!

Delicious- I don't think I let the ponzu sauce thicken enough but it still worked well. After plating i added some fresh cilantro for color and an orange slice. Also perhaps using a low salt soy sauce would reduce the sodium content.

68985.Review: This made a great afternoon snack for me combining one of my favourite fruits with some of my favourite flavours! I reduced this recipe for one by halving the dressing and using 1/4 of a papaya. For ease of eating I peeled the papaya and cut it into cubes before combining with the delicious dressing. Even though it is winter I thoroughly enjoyed this and will make it again!

I prepared it as suggested but 
using nonfat vanilla yogurt.This
sauce is great with any fresh fruit
salad it gives it a new twist without masking the true natural taste of your selected fruits.
Will be using this recipe much
more often, It prooves that imagi-
nation and creativity is our best 
culinary tool. Thanks

The simple yogurt sauce is perfect to compliment the papaya -  This sauce will be good on any fruit or fruit salad.  So simple to make too . I was lucky and found the small papayas (half just right for 1 serving)  Thanks for posting this delish recipe ~Bekah~

69566.Review: Excellent!  I had some leftover pumpkin to use up, so the amount I put in was more like 1 cup instead of 3/4.  Also, the recipe didn't say whether or not to grease the pan, but I did spray it with some cooking spray, which was probably a good idea.  It didn't taste very pumpkin-y, but turned out very moist with good flavour.  Thanks for sharing!
This was very good.  I made two batches and used one in my cornbread stuffing and it was a hit!

76164.Review: This beautiful bread looked so lovely at my office Christmas party buffet table.  It tastes great too and it's easy enough to make as well.  The dough is VERY easy to work with and I found I didn't need to add much more flour in step #7.  I wish I could have gotten a better picture of it but it was ripped into as soon as I put it on the table!  Thanks for posting this Sharon...I gave away quite a few copies of this recipe today :)

Delicious and moist. I love the combination of spinach, red pepper, and tomato!  Because there are only two of us, I divided the dough in 2, and rolled out 2 rectangles, split the pesto mixture between the two, and then brought up the sides and ends and flipped it upside down.  I also cut slits prior to final rising.  I baked both loaves on the same sheet at 350 degrees for about 25 minutes.  Then I froze the second loaf.  Thanks Sharon123 for sharing.  Made for 1-2-3 Hit Wonder game.

87914.Review: Delicious. Quick and easy enough for everyday, good enough for company. I did find there was a lot of filling (I may have measured generously) but did get it all in there. Cooking time was perfect. I'll be making this again.

Great recipe!  My family really enjoyed this one.  It was easy to make and tasted delicious.  The only changes I made were to sprinkle the chicken with salt and pepper and too cook the chicken a little longer.

Very good...a simple recipe for a quick dinner for 2- I used 2 thin sliced pieces of chicken, cut the recipe in half, put the filling on one of the sides and folded over the chicken instead of slitting a pocket and  I just pinched the edges.  I also lightly breaded them, and put a small amount of olive oil in the pan to cook them- they came out great, and I will be cooking again soon!Thanks!!!

I had sun-dried tomato pesto on hand so I used that to replace the tomatoes and olive oil.  I flattened each breast. made a two breast "sandwich" with the cheese, etc, dipped them in panko and sauteed them on medium-low heat. Then I served each of us 1/2 a "sandwich."  Delicious, Dancer.

90331.Review: These were fabulous! I love fried, crispy foods but try not to eat them too often. This is a bit of a compromise- not fried but still crispy! Served with a ranch style dip for a snack. Thanks, I will make this one again!
This was very good, we enjoyed this. Very crispy and delish...thanks for posting, I will make this again!....KC :)

Delicious, Marie! Always thrilled when I can enjoy breaded foods without deep-frying them. Very flavorful and nicely browned- enjoyed them with Ranch dressing. Will definitely be making these again! Thanks for the recipe!
We loved these! Easy to make, attractive, and best of all, delicious. I followed the recipe exactly and wouldn't change a thing. Thanks for posting.
a very good hassle-free, guilt-free snack. anything without the frying gets my vote. we gobbled these up pretty fast with some ranch dip. thanks for a new use for the ubiquitous zucchini!

My DH and I made these last night and they were really good. I love deep-fried zucchini, but they don’t love me, and this was an excellent substitution. As others have mentioned, they are really good served with a ranch type dressing.
WOW  these are great!  my boyriend loves them fried and breaded and i prefer them plain. he didnt even know they werent fried! thanks so much for the recipe. Its a keeper!!!
I could eat these watching a movie until I couldn't see straight!  Great warmed, but also great at room temp!

These were so yummy and nicely crispy! I used plain breadcrumbs and added Italian spice; next time will add garlic powder to the crumbs because I didn't taste it from the egg mixture. Will definitely make again even though the dipping and dredging was a pain in the *. Thank you Marie for another delicious recipe for zucchini!
These were great.  I love fried food but my waistline doesn't.  These are a great alternative.  I dipped mine in a cucumber sauce.  Thanks.

Wonderful! These really tasted fried! I cut the fat a little bit more by using egg substitute and it worked just fine. I added 1/2 teaspoon of salt to the crumb mixture in a zip-top bag, and tossed the egg-coated zucchini slices in the bag, 3 at a time. I used 4 garlic cloves in the egg mixture, but next time (and there will be many next times!)I think I'll try a 1/2 teaspoon or so of garlic powder right in the bag, because we LOVE garlic. Thanks, Marie for a great recipe and such a treat for people who must watch their fat intake! A keeper.

These little rounds were very good!  They are easy to make which I loved.  I made as posted but I would have liked a little more garlic flavor so will add more next time.  I served alongside our spaghetti dinner and got thumbs up all around.  Thanks for posting!

This was a very nice recipe. Easy to make and very tasty. The only changes I made were to add more garlic as others suggested and to add some Emeril's Bam seasonings to the breadcrumbs for a little zing. Thank you for a great recipe Marie.

These were very good but I think the only change I would make was to put garlic powder into the breadcrumb mixture next time instead of the crushed garlic. I really liked them and they were nice and crispy but I wanted a little more garlic flavor. i also served a ranch dip with them, very good will make them again.

Very good, very simple and healthy way to make zucchini. I used egg substitute, garlic powder, 1/2 breadcrumbs, 1/2 panko and I baked them a little longer than the recipe stated. The difference in texture with the panko and breadcrumbs was nice. My DH doesn't really like zucchini but he said they were very good and that i should make them again! Only downside it that you have to eat them fresh out of the over because they get soft rather quickly.

These were really quick to make! I added garlic powder to the breadcrumb mixture, although I'll probably switch the fresh garlic from the egg mixture to the breadcrumb mixture next time. The zucchini came out next and crispy. I forgot to add the fresh parsley, and only had regular breadcrumbs, so I was missing some seasoning, but I'll definitely try this again the right way. Thanks!

Crispy, toasty, delicious.  Thanks for sharing a great recipe.
Vicki
Wonderful!  A great way to get veggies into teenagers, if served with ranch dressing!  These were absolutely delicious.  Thanks for sharing!
I could eat these all by myself.  I kept hoping my husband would stop eating them so I could finish the rest!

Awesome! I made this as a side, but when I looked down, my boyfriend had eaten all of these (and not the chicken)and was asking for more. I added garlic powder to the breadcrumb mixture and it was perfect. Have made this a lot and will continue to make!

Awesome recipe.  I don't measure but I kept the amounts consistant. The breading was fabulous and flavorful.  Even my DH who doesn't usually give 5 stars said this deserved it!  Thanks for a great side we will make again!

AND another great recipe!!!  I did these tonight along with your Zresty Oven Baked Fries.  As much as I enjoyed the fries (and will be making them lots in the future), these zucchini chips were HEAVEN!!!  I have a zucchini left in the fridge and am seriously thinking that I may just sneak back in the kitchen and whip up another batch!!!  I order the fried zucchini in restaurants a lot -- but these top ANY I have had.  I did find that I needed to bake them a bit longer -- but maybe that was because I had other things going on in the oven at the same time.  We used the ranch dressing -- low fat, low cal.  With all the flavor the chips had -- we didn't even notice that the dressing was "diet friendly".   I really encourage others to try this recipe.  I'm going to post it on the inside of my cupboard door -- because I know it's gonna be used so often.  Yummy, yum, yum!!!
Loved the taste and ease of preparation of these, Marie.  Another great way to use up the summer succhini.  Sorry it took me so long to post rating.

These did not turn out like the description unfortunately.  I, too, had the problem of the breading not sticking on the zucchini chips.  But, I kept pressing it on anyways and didn't flip them over as the breading would have fallen off.  They weren't crispy, but they were still a tasty version of baked zucchini.  Thanks marie!
I didn't really care for these.  The zucchini was NOT crispy, and kinda soggy on the inside.  I ended up throwing them out.  Sorry.

Amazing! I used eggstirs & added garlic & powder. I also used mostly dried parsley flakes instead of fresh because my parsley plant needs some healing time lol.

Thank you for this gem of a recipe!!
These were excellent! I made them as directed except I used dried parsley instead of fresh. Thanks!
Very good, Thank you for the recipe! No fresh parsley on hand, so I had to use dry, but still came out great.I think next time I will serve them with a  choice of marinara sauce or ranch.

Oh wow, I think is my new favorite way to eat zucchini!  I have made them twice, followed the recipe exactly, except the first time I used panko instead of breadcrumbs.  I liked the panko better, got nice and crispy : ) Thanks! This is a keeper.
I really enjoyed these. It was a nice change and lower fat is always a good thing in my book! My fiance was not as happy, he prefers the usual steamed method but agreed they were good.
that wasnt bad

This was a really great side-dish that ended up as an almost main dish. I served it with bbq'd chicken sandwiches the first time I made it. It was a little time consuming though, and I must have been using bigger zucchinis than average, because I ended up having to make twice or three times as much dry breading. PS   it really tastes great if you let the garlic sit in the egg overnight, or as long as possible!

These were good.  Like a previous reviewer, I will add some garlic powder to the dry mixture next time.  I used grated parmesan from a can, but next time I will grate my own for more parmesan taste.  Very good.  Thank you for sharing.

I give this 10 stars. I've tried other zucchini chips in the oven and these turned out the best. I used garlic powder and garlic. Mixture of panko and breadcrumbs. Baked mine a little longer -- we like them crunchy. I've thrown my other baked zucchini chips away. Perfect!

Delicious!  We made some changes, but these were better than any fried zucchini I've ever had ANYWHERE!  We had no bread crumbs so we substituted crushed cheese & garlic croutons from Trader Joe's.  Also, we used more like 3 cloves of garlic, and omitted the parsley since we did not have any of that.  We dipped them in ranch dressing and they were out of this world!  Thanks for the submission!

well, i made these from pre-sliced zucchini i had frozen a couple months ago in the freezer, so they were a bit thinner than the 1/4" in the recipe--closer to 1/8".  but i definitely didn't have a problem with them coming out mushy.  i used 1 t. of jarred crushed garlic and that was probably a bit too much--1/2 t. would've been better.  also, i cooked an additional 5 mins. on the first side since they were frozen when i dipped and coated them (i slammed them in the bag against the counter to loosen them up and knock some ice off them.  they separated even more easily after a few minutes).  not quite carl's jr. caliber (my gold standard), but pretty close--will try again with thicker slices.  just wish they weren't so much work--drive thru is wayyy easier!
I love this and will make it again. A nice, healthy, way to eat zucchini.

These were very good.  My BH liked them, so that is good enough for me to do these again.  I used garlic powder instead of minced, worked fine.  I also think that slicing them length-wise instead of rounds will help with the turning.  These were very crispy on the outside and tender on the inside.  Perfect for the oven.  Thanks for posting Marie! =^..^=
good idea, and I'll work on it, but not as tasty as I hoped.  I like cajun flavoring so I'll probably add more of that.
Mmmmmm....this dish is very good.  They turned crispy and cooked great.  My kids liked them with ranch, and we just liked them as it.  Thank you so much for sharing this recipe with us.
LOVED these.  I even left out the cheese (as I was out) and used matzo meal and we loved them.  This is going to be one of the ways I use our garden zucchs this summer!
These were a good use of our copious summer zucchini. I added about 1/2 tsp salt and a few dashes of cayenne pepper to the dry milk to spice things up.

Tried these tonight with cornflake crumbs since I was using them with another recipe. Not a great idea. :) Wonderful as written...not so wonderful with cornflake crumbs. Originally posted: 8/24/09 These were so good! Just as good as fried, and no guilty feelings while eating them. I omitted the cheese since I was out. LOVED the garlic in the egg mixture. I was so pleased with how these turned out. Served with breaded baked pork chops and corn. I did have to let them cook a bit longer to get browned, but it's much easier than standing over hot oil...making sure to turn at precisely the right moment...trying not to splash yourself. Thank you, thank you, thank you!

These were tasty and easy!  I forgot to spray the foil with non-stick cooking spray so mine stuck but they were still very good.  I used both yellow and green squash and my mandoline slicer so prep was a breeze.  Thanks for posting!

These were delicious! I skipped the egg, so obviously the breading didn't stick as well as it could have. I also subbed some roasted garlic for the raw smashed clove. Perfect cooking time in my toaster oven!
Good!!!
Excellent! Topped each with a dollop of marinara sauce & mozzarella and melted under broiler. Served with linguini! Delish!

So Easy - So Delicious!
These are really, REALLY good! I added a little celery salt to the second round, and it added a great flavor.
Great recipe!  Thanks for posting.
Very good! I might try and baked them on a rack next time and mess with the seasoning. Thanks for posting.

This is very good. I halved the recipe but otherwise followed it and served it with baked salmon.  It would have been helpful to know how much zucchini was needed, though.  After quite a bit of research, I used one about 7" long, which seemed to be about right.  I ate the whole thing.

I made this according to the recipe and it was very, very good!  I know that I'll be making this again.  I'm always confused by the term "grated" and I used the fine shredding side on the grater.  I think that next time I should use the side that produces the tiny pieces becuse the little shredded pieces didn't mix very well and were mostly on the first half of the batch.  Thank you for posting this recipe!
Really good.  I ended up with not quite enough breading to cover my zucchini, but maybe I sliced them thinner than directed.  Not too hard to mix up some more, though.
great alternative to frying!

Most excellent!!  I used just one7 inch zucchini sliced rather thin.  I had a bit of egg and bread crumbs left so I cut up some asparagus.  For the bread crumbs I used half seasoned regular crumbs and half panko crumbs.  We dipped them in homemade ranch dressing.  Will definately be making this often.

Wow these turned out to be such a good last minute idea I had to bake them a little longer but my oven is touchy. I would like to tell anyone who doesnt have a clove of garlic( i didnt) that I added garlic powder in its place and it actually turned out so well my neighbors came over an asked me what I was making and if they could try it...good thing I made 4 zucchinis worth so I could get away with sharing
Anyone have a good dipping sauce for this?
This was delicious! Grandkids loved it.

92028.Review: Might as well double..or even triple this recipe!  I first had them in Vancouver,BC.  These babies are to die for!  They make the best ever Christmas cookies too!

I'm from Vancouver and we all make these bars for special occasions. When I moved to Colorado, my friends there had never heard of Nanaimo Bars. (Nanaimo is a town on Vancouver Island) They loved them!  These are very addictive. And I agree, they are fabulous frozen too!

OMG...had never even heard of these until a few weeks ago, but they are to-die-for!  This recipe is perfect.  I chopped my coconut in the food processor a bit to make it "finer", and used 3 T. ff instant vanilla pudding powder for the vanilla custard powder.  These are decadent, and definitely a permanent addition to my "keeper" recipe book!
These are like a creamy, candy bar.  I've never had these before, but they are rich, and wonderful!  I'm passing the recipe along, as well as adding it to my permanent file.

OH WOW!  These are wonderful.  Over 20 years ago a neighbor gave me a cookie tray for Christmas and these were included.  The next year she called and asked if she had given me the recipe.  Unfortunately she had not.  I had never had these again until now.  I made a variation by adding 3/4 teaspoon mint extract and a couple of drops green food coloring to the middle layer.  Thanks for posting such a delicious and varied recipe.

I love Nanaimo Bars but dont like too much icing in the middle.   I make mine a bit different, using the same recipe, I double the bottom layer (use a 9x13" pan)  little more than half the icing layer and of course the chocolate on top!
Lots of family and friends prefer eating them just out of the freezer for a bit.

These freeze very well and yes they do taste great frozen!  They are a wonderful treat and don't last long.  I score the top chocolate layer when partially set (into squares) to make them easier to cut when they are fully ready to be cut.

it's not christmas without naniamo bars!! i'm from BC though so it's in my blood.  i top with dark chocolate instead of semi sweet.  i used to seel these to my friends at school when i had them.  they're like gold.  don't make them if you don't have any self control though.  (don't say i didn't warn you)

I love Nanaimo Bars (have had some nice visits to Nanaimo as well!)and miss them a lot! Thank goodness they are so easy to make, there are a few different flavoured ones around (orange, mint) but I prefer the vaniila custard ones best.
Thanks for sharing.
Everyone seemed to like these bars:), my only problem was that they were hard to cut and the top layer seemed to crack, but it doesn't matter if it tastes that good!
Just the way my Mom used to make them. She called it "New York Special".

I don't want to ruin the ratings, but I think I should be fair in rating the recipe.  They were pretty easy to make, but not quite the taste I was expecting. Not many people in my family liked these- maybe just a different taste.  Sorry, I will not be making them again :(

These are amazing!  My fiance grew up in Nanaimo and really enjoyed these treats!  The only two things I revised was baking first layer for 15 minutes & let cool prior to putting the second layer on.  I only added 1 1/4 cups of icing sugar as the chocolate layer is sweet enough.  Great receipe!

I have always enjoyed Nanaimo Bars but had never made them. How could I have missed the making of this Canadian classic! This is an excellent recipe. So easily made, so  incredibly good. A great addition to the holiday tray and for special occasions. Thank you CountryLady.

I love these!  They are so wonderfully rich tasting.  
whenever I make them there are no leftovers and everybody loves them.

I have been making nanaimo bars for years but found this recipe which was just a bit different from my recipe so I  decided to follow this one and sure happy I did. This base is  a bit more moist and has more of the middle layer. I did replace 1/2 cup coconut with unsweetened coconut but that is just a personal taste. My copy has now been replaced with your version. The holidays just wouldn't be the same with the Nanaimo bar not on that goodie tray.

These little treats tasted great and I thought were pretty easy to make. I didn't have any graham cracker crumbs, but I did have graham crackers, so I put the crackers in my blender until they were fine. These treats were great on our xmas tray as they are always a tradition! Thanks very much for the recipe CountryLady!

Liked it.  However, next time, I think I will do the bottom, middle layer, and chill in the fridge.  Once chilled, cut them, and then add the third layer.  I wasn't too crazy about the topping layer being hard, I would rather it be more like a frosting.
These were good. However, I felt that the bottom layer was a little too crumbly (maybe i did something wrong). Nonetheless, these were still really good.
This is my exact recipe. I've made this recipe dozens of times over the years and never a problem. I've even made them for friends over the holidays. This is the perfect recipe for Nanaimos.
Very good! I use less sugar in the icing layer and double the top layer! Perfect!

Very good! Everyone I shared these with loved them, the perfect mix, not TOO sweet. The base was nice, a bit chewy and a little different from what I'm used to but I prefer it. I won't use another recipe.
Doesn't get better then Nanaimo Bars, and this recipe is easy and delicious!

I had a craving for some nanaimo bars so I found this recipe. It didn't turn out as well as I expected so I'm not too sure what I did wrong :( I found the bottom layer to be a bit dry and subsequently crumbly. I only had an 8x8 pan available so I did my best to make everything even, and save a bit from each layer so it wouldn't be too thick. The middle layer was delicious, as usual. And a warning to everyone - heat the chocolate (I recommend using real chocolate, not chocolate chips), very slowly!! Also, after your squares have been made, sit them out for a bit and cut them before the chocolate top is completely hardened, but not while it is too soft that it's still runny!

(Â¯`Â·._)â™¦These are very good. My husband and son enjoyed them. I happen to have had one of these delectables the other day and thought I would try my hand at it. I found that in the base (bottom) if I used real butter and mixed everything while it was still hot, it did not seem to be crumby, as a few people have said. I mixed it past the crumbly stage, so it was almost a dough.. and when I patted it out, it was almost like a brownie. I place in the fridge for about a half hour then used a very sharp thin knife with a straight edge, keeping it on an angle, it did not break or crack the top. The center set up nicely, the top was very easy. (used the double boiler method, as you do with the bottom) The recipe was straightforward and fairly easy to concoct. Very rich, which is a good thing, because you can keep portions small, and still feel satisfied. Thanks for a great recipe, I am sure I will use this again.â™¦(_.Â·Â´Â¯)

This was by far one of the best desserts I've made!  Thank you so much for posting this!  YUMMO!  I could not find the custard powder so I replaced with 3 tbsp vanilla instant pudding and I made the replacement suggestion for the icing sugar and my family was WOW'd! I will absolutely be making this again!  Wish I could give more then 5 stars  =)

An excellent recipe and a definate staple for Xmas. I always make 2 for Xmas, the original recipe for my children and an adult version for adults by exchanging liqueur for milk in middle layer and, depending on the flavour of liqueur, substituting different nuts for the walnuts in base. Amaretto with toasted almonds, Frangelico with hazelnuts, the possibilities are endless!

Worth all the effort and time it took to make. I have no idea how pronounce them other than MMM MMM GOOD!!! Will be making another batch soon as these seemed to evaporate quickly sitting on the counter. :-)
THANKS!
I had not had these in years.  I did everything exactly as directed and they turned out wonderfully.
These are such a delicious treat...it would be hard not to eat just one.  Don't think of the calories when you eat them...they are so worth it! Nanaimo is pronounced : Na-NYE-mo.  Great posting!!
It's impossible to spread the custard layer without refrigerating the bottom layer - I just ended up with a giant mess and had to go back to the store and do it all again.  Poor instructions.

I needed a dish that was truly Canadian for an event we are doing this weekend. This is a really good and easy recipe for making one of my favorite foods. For the top layer I made one and a half times the recipe. Thanks for sharing
i think you should try and make smores out out ice cream and the try it and so it will be fun

92461.Review: Two words....yum, yum!  Pretty darn close to the original!

Excellent. I lived in Dallas for almost 20 years--for as long as I can remember, I ordered La Madeleine's Strawberries Romanoff.  What an incredible clone. Really can't tell the difference. My dinner guests raved and raved--men and women alike. La Madeleine serves it in a large round-bowled red wine glass.  Fill the glass 3/4 full with large cut strawberries and top with a huge dollup of the Romanoff sauce.  Also looks beautiful in a sturdy Martini glass if you don't have the other. Thanks so much for submitting the recipe.

Made this for Mother's Day for 15 people and there wasn't a drop leftover.  Everyone was asking for the recipe - even my 6-year-old niece insisted that I give it to her mom!  Thank you thank you thank you!!
So simple and so good!! Definitely a family favorite. Thanks so much

Just lovely!  Simple and delicious.  I used Contreau.  I made one batch as written and some that was diet friendly (fat-free yogurt, brown sugar splenda and fat free cool whip - still added Contreau!).  Thanks for posting!

I've never eaten at La Madeleine and had never heard of Strawberries Romanoff.  I had to try your recipe as I'm always looking for new ideas for strawberries. I'm so glad I did because it's absolutely delicious!  Made for Spring 2010 Pick A Chef.
This is such an elegant dessert - we make it with vanilla and to me it's even better than La Madeleine's.   To add a bit of crunch, I serve it with Pepperidge Farm Bordeaux cookies.
I tried this today and was so pleased with the results.  The flavor was wonderful, I didn't have any brandy so I used congac. So simply and a great addition to summer berries.
This should be illegal - it is addictive. So simple and so delicious. Used the vanilla. Will certainly make again.
I used cream sherry and served over lady fingers
The recipe in the La Madeleine cookbook calls for Cognac instead of Brandy.  Once you make that small change it will taste exactly like what you get at La Madeleine.

OH MY GOODNESS.  This is AMAZING.  I just ate two bowls.  I never write reviews, but after making this was thoroughly compelled.  I have been dying for these and la madeleine is just two expensive for that tiny glass and they never give you enough sauce.  I made it with vanilla and it still tasted amazing.  I used organic cream that was practically whipped by the time I took it out the carton (it was the good stuff), it made the fluffiest whip cream I have ever had.  Horizon doesn't even come close.  I added a touch of cinnamon and a pinch of salt to add a depth to the flavor.  I even used my little mini bullet processor to whip the cream (just add the sugar in from the beginning).  This recipe is amazing.  I will now live a happier life. :)
This was wonderful!!! Just like La Madeleine. I have been looking for this recipe for years! Definitely a keeper!
Made this for dessert today (Valentine's Day) Very good.  I didn't have the liquor so used vanilla as suggested.  Really yummy.  Next time I may try it with orange liquour.
Made with cognac, used reduced fat sour cream, and topped with a sprinkle of cinnamon. Otherwise, followed the recipe as is. Absolutely Delish! No leftovers. Enjoyed by all!
What a fantastic Summer dessert! Delicious!

Absolutely delicious. I used a little less of both sugars (didn't measure) and in the absence of brandy used Chambord liqueur. Serving in a snifter or tall footed wine glass makes this an elegant multi layered desert

I've been making this recipe for years! Every time strawberries go on sale, strawberries romanoff are on the dessert menu. I've made this for many people who are impressed, yet this devilishly delicious dessert is surprisingly simple and very easy to make with little to no cooking experience. Always make in large batches because you can never quite have enough!
This is my wife's favorite. I made it for mother's day and she loved it. Now we dont have to go to Le Madeleine to enjoy it.

97687.Review: This was good.  The cornstarch gave the sauce a nice consistency.  I added a little more crushed red pepper, but I like things more spicy than most folks!! ; > I found myself wanting add some salt, just to bring out the flavors a little more.  So I tossed the shrimp with salt and pepper before I cooked them, and added a few shakes of soy sauce to the sauce as well.  Adding the tofu back at the END really helps it to stay in cubes and not fall apart.

Simply outstanding! Have made this twice as a supper dish with basmati rice.  Love it, love it, love it! Didn't change anything except for simple replacements like arrowrroot powder for cornstarch, and stevia for sugar. The 2nd time we had this I added diced red pepper in with the garlic and shrimp and frozen green peas at the end, with the tofu. They just need the warming up. So, although it'll feed more as an appetizer, this dish feeds DH and I just fine! Hey Jude, I can't thank you enough for posting this recipe!

This was such an excellent quick  tasty dinner! I tossed the tofu cubes in a little cornstarch to help them get a crispy edge before stir frying but otherwise followed the recipe exactly. Will definitely be making this again! Thanks!

I made this last night for the first time, and I loved it. I added oyster mushrooms to the first cooking step, and liked them. Very easy, though I found the timings were a bit off (my shrimp was cooked before I added the hoisin sauce), but continued to cook through and it was delicious. I made myself stop after one bowl so I'd have left-overs for tonight!

Woww...This is really yummy dish.  My kids and I really loved it.  Thanks for sharing this recipe.  I'm using japanese tofu for this this recipe and I deep fried the tofu (coated with a bit of cornstarch) first before added to the sauce and shrimps.
Easy to make, turned out pretty good. A little sweet for our taste buds so I would recommend reducing the sugar or hoisin content.

I was looking for something quick and easy to do with frozen cooked shrimp and firm tofu, and this was perfect! I had fresh green onions and even fresh ginger on hand. The only substitutions I made was for the hoisin sauce since I didn't have any. I used House of Tsang Bangkok Peanut Sauce and skipped the sugar and red pepper flakes since it's somewhat sweet and spicy already. I used about a tsp and a half of fresh ginger. I also used about twice as much fresh garlic I thin just because I was in a hurry and not reading carefully. In any case, it was delicious. I thawed the precooked shrimp in running water, removed tails and let them drain well while making the sauce and sauteeing the tofu. Thanks for such an ideal recipe!

101781.Review: Meatloaf, some leftover  soup & Pammy's Awesome gravy recipe equals one fine tasting dinner.   I had about 3/4 cup of mushroom soup in the fridge so I scaled down your recipe.  It was so easy with great flavor.  Thanks Chef#166103 for a neat shortcut for a quick gravy
Excellent!  I love it.  Almost as good as my grandmother's old fashioned pan browned gravy.

We had guests for dinner and I made  this to go with turkey meatloaf. This really tasted like great gravy and not just mushroom soup! I was surprised that it didn't taste too salty, either, since I usually find that with the canned soups (used regular beef broth and Healthy Choice  Mushroom soup). This made our dinner really special. I am already thinking turkey broth to make a turkey gravy, too. Thanks Packer Backer Pammy.

Made this gravy to go with recipe #272759 (Crock Pot Meatloaf) and they were a match made in heaven. This is a smooth, creamy gravy that takes only minutes to prepare. It would be good with turkey or beef as well. Thanks for sharing, Pammy!

LOVE this recipe. Tonight I added a bit of Kitchen Bouquet to darken it, and a little white wine for tang. Stirred in a bit of Wondra flour to thicken more, and served over hot meatloaf sandwiches. This got a thumbs up from the diners. Thanks, Pammy!

104399.Review: I'm sorry but my family did not enjoy these muffins.  They were heavy and flavorless.

We loved these muffins!  I have been looking for something not so sweet for breakfast.  This is it!!  Very easy to make.  
Yummy
My family & I also liked this recipe. We will have it again. Raisin Bran is my favorite cereal so I knew I'd like it. Thanks for sharing.
This was good for a bran muffin. I would like to offer the suggestion that you add some cinnamon... that little bit of stuff was magical for this recipe!!!

108001.Review: Salud! Awesome drink! I used Vanilla vodka and it added a little extra touch of sweetness! I just love Cosmo's! thanks for sharing this great recipe!
Now this is really good.  Sis and I made these up last night and made for a great cocktail after a busy day at work for both of us. I've never had a cosmo before.  Thanks
I also used vanilla vodka and we enjoyed these.  Actually, we enjoyed several of these.  Thanks for sharing.
Oh Wow!!  These are Too strong for me!!  I added 4 oz of orange juice to mine and was able to drink it just fine : )  Very nice flavor when diluted!  Thanks, Melody!

A nice drink. I used Stoli but the vodka flavor seemed a bit out of balance and too 'obvious' - that would probably be less of an issue with a vanilla Stoli, will have to try it that way next time. ;o) Thanks for posting!

This was delicious (but quite potent).  I used bottled lime, because I was too lazy to squeeze, so the lime taste was a little too intense.  The fresh lime would have made a difference.  I didn't shake and strain, because I prefer having a chunk of ice in the glass.  The only thing that would improve this is to have a little cup with better ounces on the side.  I ended up using a shot glass and eyeballing the "1/2 oz." mark.  Oh, did I mention I doubled the recipe!!   lol

Thanks, Melody, for yet another favorite Cosmopolitan recipe.
We decided to try this recipe after hearing about Cosmos on Sex and the City - it's now our favourite drink.  Very easy to make & very tasty.  Thanks for sharing this Melody.

I picked out a handful of drink recipes we could try tonight & let my dh pick one.  He said he always wanted to try a cosmopolitan.  Pretty good.  He really liked it.  I think I would like it more with vanilla vodka or perhaps one of the flavored vodkas that are posted here.  This looks like the beginning of a wonderful journey!  Thank you very much for the recipe - it's a keeper!
my favorite too....though I use countreau instead of triple sec, it makes it a little sweeter...

We had a pool closing party last night and these were the hit with the ladies.  I did 7 servings at a time (as that was the amount that would fit in the pitcher I was using).  We premixed so I wouldn't be making martini's all night...we just had to shake shake shake.  We neded up making four batches!  Thanks for posting this!

Cosmos are my favorite!!!  I have bartended for YEARS, I personally make my with Absolute Citron and Cointreau.  I Also serve it with a fresh squeezed lime.  I do 2 1/2 ozs.  of Citron, 1 1/2 Cointreau.  About an 1 oz of Cranberry.  It's all a matter of your personal taste.  ENJOY!
I'm very domestic and my usual is Tide with a splash of Downey.  Nice change.
The ingredient and proportions are just perfect. Highly recommend using fresh lime juice. Delish!

109552.Review: A very good stew --the cloves and cinnamon not only give it a wonderful flavor, but the perfume is great--I used less oil, very lean beef, and a bit more cinnamon (an accident).  I particularly liked that there was no dredging the meat in flour.  The result is a very clean kind of taste.  Served it over soft polenta with eggplant cream on the side--a lovely meal.

Evelyn, this was delicious and really easy to make.  I used lamb shoulder that I cut into cubes.  I used a little powdered cloves, and threw in 2 cinnamon sticks, as that's what I had in the house.  Thanks a million -- this one's a real keeper.
Comfort Food ~ Like it should be! I followed instructions precisely (Used Beef)  which resulted in a VERY RICH THICK and FLAVORFUL SAUCE, which we had over PASTA. YUM!

This was a pretty good basic stew. We really liked the addition of the cinnamon but felt the stew needed a little extra kick, so we added lots of freshly ground black pepper, a little salt and a handful of chilli flakes. The meat was very tender and the sauce nice and thick. We served it as suggested over rice. I would make this again but with the extra seasonings and I would also cut down on the oil by as much as half.

Fantastic! Wonderful! Delicious! I only made a slight change in adding a few additional spices and that was to add one turkish bay leaf and a sprinkling of mediterranean oregano, fresh black pepper and kosher salt. I used beef chuck I cut into cubes myself though I would have liked to have used lamb if I had had it on hand. We served it with rice and the SUBLIME Hunkar Begendi. My dh was groaning with pleasure after each bite since the eggplant cream was an amazing compliment to the delicious stew. Thank you for yet another fantastic, make again and again recipe!!
Good stew. I used beef and served with mashed potatoes. Comfort food!

I made this tonight using left over shoulder of lamb.  I let it simmer for about an hour, and as some other reviewers suggested added more cinnamon and chilli flakes.  I also added a small can of tomato puree as I didn't have enough tomato.  It was so good and left the kitchen smelling lovely!  Thanks for sharing!

I would give this 10 stars if I could.  Evelyn, you never disappoint - this was an absolutely fabulous stew.  We used lamb, added about a cup of carrots, and a wee bit more wine (actually, we used both red and white), but otherwise made exactly as directed, and served with a dollop of mashed potatoes.  The aromas and flavors of the stew are divine.  We'll be making this often, and can't wait to have friends over to share this perfect cold-weather meal.  Thank you!

112745.Review: Very simple and tasty dip. Made as directed and served with tortilla chips. Thanks!

I had this recipe at Rita's and it was SOO good . I tried it on my family and friends @ a Super Bowl Party and it all went.
This is a very easy recipe and very good.
Keep giving us GREAT RECIPES Rita.
Your friend,
Dolly
An easy snack-spicy enough to warm me up on a cold Wisconsin day! Followed the recipe except I just mashed the beans right in the bowl (to avoid any dishes to wash.) This is delicious; thanks Rita!

Yum!  I was so hungry and didn't have alot of time (or energy) to cook and this was delicious.  Thanks for a great quick dip that I'll share at gatherings! (Maybe garnished with chopped green onion and served in a pretty ceramic bowl to look a little bit more colorful).

I made a double batch of this.  It was wonderful.  We love bean dip and it was well received by all who tried it.  I used the food processor and then put it in the crockpot. I served this with corn chips and fried flour tortillas....yummy.  Thank you for a regular in our house.....Stephanie
